medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent bone and joint pain for 1 year, recently accompanied by fever and abdominal distention.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 year prior to admission after a fall, initially presenting as pain in the left arm. The pain migrated among joints and was accompanied by rib pain intermittently. Six months before admission, severe right knee pain occurred after a minor fall. Three months prior, severe left flank pain developed. Six days before admission, the patient reported back pain, limping, and intermittent fever, with an acute presentation including abdominal distention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gastroesophageal reflux disease as an infant and pollen allergy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has hypertension; father had childhood knee pain; paternal grandmother with rheumatoid arthritis and breast cancer; paternal aunt with breast cancer; another paternal aunt with eczema. No family history of childhood arthritis, Crohnâ€™s disease, psoriasis, lupus, or thyroid disorders.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with parents who smoke outside the home and attends school and dance classes.
